critique: This document primarily deals with setting pay scales for various government employees, including those in the statutory pay systems, senior executive service, executive/legislative/judicial branches, uniformed services, and administrative law judges. It also addresses locality-based comparability payments. There's nothing inherently ideological about setting pay scales. It doesn't obviously expand or restrict executive power, as it's implementing existing laws. It doesn't touch on immigration, national security vs. civil liberties, or social inclusion. It has a very slight impact on economic regulation, as it sets government wages, but it's more of an administrative function than a policy decision to heavily intervene or deregulate. It doesn't obviously favor state or federal primacy. Therefore, most scores should be neutral.
